articles.title: Women who used birth control pills as teens are 130% more likely to be depressed as adults - Daily Mail
articles.description: Women who start taking birth control pills as teens have a 130 percent higher risk of developing depression than those who have never taken them, according to Swedish researchers.
articles.content:
